events.title: Birth of Emperor Gratian
events.description: Gratian, who later became Roman Emperor, was born. He ruled the Western Roman Empire from 367 to 383 AD, known for his efforts to suppress pagan religions and promote Christianity.
events.significance: His reign marked pivotal religious and administrative changes in the late Roman Empire.

events.title: First Battle of Bull Run (First Manassas) begins
events.description: The first major land battle of the American Civil War commenced in Prince William County, Virginia. It resulted in a Confederate victory, shattering the Union's hopes of a quick war.
events.significance: The battle demonstrated the war's likely length and severity, changing public perception about the conflict.

events.title: Scopes Trial begins in Tennessee
events.description: John T. Scopes was tried for teaching evolution in a public school, violating state law. The trial highlighted the conflict between science and religion.
events.significance: The trial attracted national attention and became a landmark legal case about education, science, and religious beliefs.

events.title: Apollo 11 astronauts walk on the Moon
events.description: Following the historic moon landing on July 20, Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin conducted their first moonwalk on July 21, becoming the first humans to walk on the lunar surface.
events.significance: This event marked a monumental achievement in human space exploration and technology.

events.title: Aswan High Dam inaugurated in Egypt
events.description: The Aswan High Dam was officially opened, becoming a vital infrastructure project that controlled flooding, provided irrigation, and generated hydroelectric power.
events.significance: It significantly boosted Egypt's agricultural capacity and energy production, shaping the nation's development.
